title: Learning team: 2016 Vision
body:
We want to build a more data literate society by reaching new audiences and providing accessible ways for anyone to learn.

We believe that open data is changing and learning needs to change with it. We will create learning that anyone can use where, when and how they want. We want to make beautiful, intuitive content that leaves an impression on everyone who experiences it. 2016 will see the transition from learning by the hundreds to learning by the tens of thousands.

title: Goals
body:
The overall goal of the learning team is to build a more data literate society by reaching new audiences and providing accessible ways for anyone to learn.

This goal can be split down into five priorities:
instruction: Click the forward arrow for more.Select the ‘+’ sign to explore further, then swipe the image to see more.

_items.title: 1) Increase our reach
_items.body:
The programme, in addition to new face-to-face courses, will launch online learning.

Through short online modules the programme will increase reach, drive conversion to face-to-face courses and enable ongoing engagement through webinars and community events.

_items.title: 2) Build our network
_items.body:
The programme will expand the registered trainer network to help reach more people face-to face.

2016 will also see the introduction of ODI Learning Associates as a way to recognise those who inspire and lead open data education activities.

_items.title: 3) Create inspiring content
_items.body:
The programme will maintain our commitment to create inspiring, world-leading content for any audience.

In addition we will be adding Training Packs to online courses (available via the menu in the top right) that our network can use to build their own learning materials.

Our registered trainers can use these to build new ODI courses. Associates are free to access, use and share this content.

_items.title: 4) Streamline our delivery
_items.body:
The programme will make access to learning consistently simple and rewarding through a new ODI Learning Management System.

You are using this system right now!

It will make all learning, whether face-to-face, online or mobile, into a unified journey.

The system will be our channel to the world. A place where you can explore, discover, book training, access materials and engage with community events.

Most of all the system is easy. You feel like you know how to use it already and no matter how foreign the topic or how different the course, the system is familiar.

_items.title: 5) Actively engage network
_items.body:
The programme will target our network to develop new courses and content for the Learning Management System and eLearning platform.

We will introduce a 'fast track' programme for select registered trainers, allowing them to make their own courses accessible via the eLearning platform and to as many people as possible.

title: 3 stages of engagement
body:
Not everyone can reach a training room. Increasing reach and content delivery in 2016 will be focused through a three stage pipeline.

This pipeline will be backed with a new Skills framework which details competences for beginners, practitioners and experts in open data skills.
instruction: The three stages of engagement are briefly described below.

_items.title: Face-to-face training
_items.body:
Face-to-face training is the cornerstone of a lasting relationship with our learners.

In 2016 our face-to-face courses will focus on 2 key areas: skills and sectors. In 2016 we will add new courses focussing on business development, agriculture, finance and the environment. We shall also be expanding our offering of public data science courses.

We will also revisit Open Data in Practice, Law and licensing and finding stories as part of a constant cycle of innovation and improvement

We will also be working with the network to introduce a number of new courses not owned by ODIHQ.

_items.title: Anytime learning
_items.body:
2016 will see the launch of not only the online learning platform but also mobile learning. Mobile means anyone, anywhere can get high-quality open data education: No internet required.

All courses produced via this Learning Management System can be quickly and effectively delivered for offline learning and consumption on planes, trains and in less well connected countries.

All courses and sessions created both internally and by the network will have associated anytime learning modules.

_items.title: Focused engagements
_items.body:
Following learning, the team will be increasing its offer of innovation workshops to include member webinars and expert panels.

Such events will provide value to the network and offer a sense of connection to the ODI.

Online events will be advertised through the anytime learning platforms built in mechanism.

title: Enterprise training products
body:
Shifting to the anytime learning space will allow the development and delivery of enterprise scale learning.

For enterprises this will mean focused training can be delivered to thousands of staff, quickly and easily.
instruction: Click the headings below to find out more.

_items.title: Customised learning
_items.body:
In addition to a standard public facing product, anytime learning can be customised to suit the needs of a customer.

A large portfolio of modules can be combined to build a unique product. In addition new modules can be easily added which provide key messages relevant to each customer.

Finally, each product can be delivered in customer branding, thus meeting an internal training need of that organisation.

_items.title: Enterprise delivery
_items.body:
To reach everyone, custom delivered anytime eLearning will be delivered as enterprise products.

This will mean that distribution, support and and monitoring can be combined into one product for delivery via organisation enterprise programmes. This provides a one click mechanism to engage thousands of people.

_items.title: Professional analytics
_items.body:
Full breakdown of user engagement on a per module and course basis will detail completion, time taken, pass rates and user behavior.

The analytics dashboard will allow senior executives to quickly view programme results, effectiveness and reach.

This will allow workforces to train quickly and effectively in open data.

title: Innovative projects
body:
2016 will see a growth in the learning team project portfolio

Projects provide focus on innovation, new modes of delivery.

Projects link all aspects of the three stage pipeline and allow us to deliver more effectively and be agile to future change.
